node.text:
😃 Mood - 心情 - xīnqíng ☹️ ⁣
Read below for more information on our new word of the day! Swipe for stroke order.⁣
⁣
心情 is a noun that means mood, state of mind. ⁣
⁣
💓 心 means heart. It is a common character that can be found as a radical in many words, most of which are related to the heart and feelings. ⁣
⁣
As a radical, 心 can be written just like the character itself, but it will look a bit squashed! For example, in the words 想 (xiǎng - think, want), 息 (xí - rest), 感 (gǎn - feel), 思 (sī - think, consider), etc. ⁣
⁣
心 as a radical can also be found on the left side of characters. In this case, it is written like this: 忄. (For example, 慢 màn - slow and 忙 máng - busy.)⁣
⁣
The second character in our word of the day, 情, also has the 心 heart radical. In this case it means feeling, but it can also mean situation, as in the word 情况 (qíngkuàng - circumstances). ⁣
⁣
So, heart 心 + feeling 情 = mood, state of mind, because your mood depends on what your heart is feeling!⁣
⁣
⛩Traditional characters: same as simplified⁣
⁣
📝This is an HSK 4 word!⁣
⁣
⭐Example sentences:⁣ •	考试没考好，影响了我的心情。(Kǎoshì méi kǎo hǎo, yǐngxiǎng le wǒ de xīnqíng.) I didn’t do well in the exam and it affected my mood. ⁣ •	我现在没心情出去玩儿。(Wǒ xiànzài méi xīnqíng chūqù wán’er.) I’m not on the mood to go out right now.⁣ •	他今天有说有笑的，心情特别好。(Tā jīntiān yǒu shuō yǒu xiào de, xīnqíng tèbié hǎo.) He talked and smiled today, and was in a very good mood.⁣
.⁣
.⁣
.⁣
.⁣
.⁣
⁣
#myfirstchinesewords #learnchinese #learnmandarin #language #languagelearning #chineseforkids #chinese #mandarin #flashcards #hsk #cinese #中文 #汉语 #普通话 #wordoftheday #china #中国 #cina #pinyin #chinesecharacter #hanzi #studychinese #汉字 #beijing #shanghai #学习汉语 #mood #moodoftheday #drawing #illustration

⛽️ Petrol station 加油站 - jiāyóuzhàn⛽️⁣
Read below for more information on our new word of the day! Swipe for stroke order.⁣
⁣
This HSK 4 word means petrol (or gas) station. It is actually three words put together, and if you look at them one by one it is easier to memorise the meaning!⁣
⁣
- ➕ 加 (jiā) means to add, to put in, plus +⁣
- 🛢油 (yóu) means oil, petroleum⁣
- 🚏站 (zhàn) means stop, station⁣
⁣
So ‘petrol station’ in Chinese is “add + oil + station”! Easy!⁣
⁣
⛩Traditional characters: same as simplified⁣
⁣
📝This is an HSK 4 word!⁣
⁣
⭐️Example sentences: ⁣
- 去加油站加点儿油吧。(Qù jiāyóuzhàn jiā diǎn’er yóu ba.) Go to the petrol station to get some petrol. ⁣
- 我们中间要路过一个加油站。(Wǒmen zhōngjiān yào lùguò yīgè jiāyóuzhàn.) We are passing by a petrol station.⁣
- 加油站离这儿不太远。(Jiāyóuzhàn lí zhè'er bù tài yuǎn.). The petrol station is not far from here.⁣
.⁣
.⁣
.⁣
.⁣
.⁣
#myfirstchinesewords #learnchinese #learnmandarin #language #languagelearning #chineseforkids #chinese #mandarin #flashcards #hsk #cinese #中文 #汉语 #普通话 #wordoftheday #china #中国 #cina #pinyin #chinesecharacter #hanzi #studychinese #汉字 #beijing #shanghai #学习汉语 #petrolstation #smartcar #drawing #illustration

👫Friend - 朋友 - péngyou👭⁣
Read below for more information on our new word of the day! Swipe for stroke order.⁣
⁣
朋友 is an HSK 1 word that means friend. 朋友们 means friends (们 ‘men’ is added to the end of some personal nouns and pronouns to make them plural). ⁣
⁣
朋 has the radical of the moon: 月 yuè. In fact, it is two 月月 placed close to each other. Is it because if the moon had another moon to hang out with then they could become friends? Maybe. Probably not, but it’s a good way to remember how to write this character, which means friend.⁣
⁣
友 also means friend. It is usually pronounced with the third tone ‘yǒu’, but with a neutral tone within the word 朋友. The radical here is 又 (yòu) which means ‘again’, ‘in addition’, linking to what we said above about the two moons that become friends! ⁣
⁣
And because it might come in handy on Valentine’s Day, 女朋友 is girlfriend (女 ‘nǚ’ means woman, so girlfriend is woman + friend, like in English) and 男朋友 is boyfriend (男 ‘nán’ means man.) ⁣
⁣
⛩Traditional characters: same as simplified⁣
⁣
📝This is an HSK 1 word!⁣
⁣
⭐️Example phrases: ⁣
最好的朋友 means best friend.⁣
友谊 (yǒuyì) means friendship.⁣
交朋友 (jiāo péngyǒu) means to make a friend. ⁣
.⁣
.⁣
.⁣
.⁣
.⁣
#myfirstchinesewords #learnchinese #learnmandarin #language #languagelearning #chineseforkids #chinese #mandarin #flashcards #hsk #cinese #中文 #汉语 #普通话 #wordoftheday #china #中国 #cina #pinyin #chinesecharacter #hanzi #studychinese #汉字 #beijing #shanghai #学习汉语 #friends #friendsarefamily #drawing #illustration

☎️Make a phone call - 打电话 - dǎ diànhuà☎️⁣
Read below for more information on our new word of the day! Swipe for stroke order.⁣
⁣
📞打电话 means ’to make a phone call’. ⁣
给他打电话 (gěi tā dǎ diànhuà) means ‘call him’, ‘give him a call’. But let’s look at each character individually:⁣
⁣
📲打 (dǎ) is a very common verb which has quite a few meanings and can be used in several different contexts. It can mean strike (as in ‘hit’), break, beat up, make, mix… you get the picture! It’s always an action that a human being can do with either an arm or a leg. A hint of this is in the⺘(shǒu - hand) radical you can spot on the left. ⁣
⁣
🗣You may be familiar with the following 打 words: 打包 (dǎbāo - takeaway), 打篮球 (dǎ lánqiú - play basketball), 打扫 (dǎsǎo - to sweep).⁣
⁣
☎️The following two characters, 电话, mean telephone or phone call. 电 (diàn) means ‘electricity’, and 话 (huà) means ‘word’ or ‘talk’. ⁣
⁣
If you add them all together:⁣
打 - make 👋⁣
电 - electricity⚡️⁣
话 - talk🗣⁣
⁣
⛩Traditional characters: 打電話⁣
⁣ 📝This is an HSK 1 word!⁣
⁣
⭐️Example sentences: ⁣
- 她正在打电话。(Tā zhèngzài dǎ diànhuà.) She is on the phone. ⁣
- 别忘了给妈妈打电话。(Bié wàngle gěi māmā dǎ diànhuà.) Don’t forget to call mum.⁣
- 明天早上九点给我打电话。(Míngtiān zǎoshang jiǔ diǎn gěi wǒ dǎ diànhuà.) Call me tomorrow at nine AM.⁣
.⁣
.⁣
.⁣
.⁣
.⁣
#myfirstchinesewords #learnchinese #learnmandarin #language #languagelearning #chineseforkids #chinese #mandarin #flashcards #hsk #cinese #中文 #汉语 #普通话 #wordoftheday #china #中国 #cina #pinyin #chinesecharacter #hanzi #studychinese #汉字 #beijing #shanghai #学习汉语 #phonecall #shopping #drawing #illustration⁣

🦠Contagious - 传染 - chuánrǎn🦠⁣
Read below for more information on our new word of the day! Swipe for stroke order.⁣
⁣
🤒With the whole world talking about the new corona virus, we decided to talk about an HSK word that is being mentioned on Chinese media very frequently:⁣
⁣
💉传染 means ‘contagious’, ‘to infect’.⁣
⁣
🤮传 means ‘to pass’, ‘spread’, ‘convey’, ‘transmit’ (you get the idea…) You may have come across it in the term 传说 (chuánshuō), meaning ‘legend’ (pass on + speak), or 传统 (chuántǒng) meaning ‘tradition’, also something that is passed on through generations. ⁣
⁣
👨🏾‍⚕️染 means several things: in this context, it means ‘contaminate’, ‘catch (a disease)’. It also means to ‘dye’, as in to colour - if you visualise a coloured dye spreading on a piece of cloth, you can easily liken it to a disease spreading in society. ⁣
⁣
🏥A 传染病 (chuánrǎn bìng = contagious + disease) is an infectious disease. A 传染病院 (chuánrǎn bìngyuàn = contagious + disease + hospital) is a hospital for infectious diseases. ⁣
⁣
⛩Traditional characters: 傳染 ⁣
⁣
📝This is an HSK 5 word!⁣
⁣
⭐️Example sentences: ⁣
- 互相传染是个大问题 (Hùxiāng chuánrǎn shìgè dà wèntí) Mutual infection is a big problem. ⁣
- 这种病传染得很快。(Zhè zhǒng bìng chuánrǎn dé hěn kuài.) This type of disease spreads quickly.⁣
- 我男朋友得了感冒，希望不要传染给我。(Wǒ nán péngyǒu déliǎo gǎnmào, xīwàng bùyào chuánrǎn gěi wǒ.) My boyfriend has a cold, I hope he doesn’t infect me with it.⁣
- 空气传染 (Kōngqì chuánrǎn) Airborne infection ⁣
.⁣
.⁣
.⁣
.⁣
.⁣
#myfirstchinesewords #learnchinese #learnmandarin #language #languagelearning #chineseforkids #chinese #mandarin #flashcards #hsk #cinese #中文 #汉语 #普通话 #wordoftheday #china #中国 #cina #pinyin #chinesecharacter #hanzi #studychinese #汉字 #beijing #shanghai #学习汉语 #drawing #illustration #口罩 #coronavirus

🎤Show - 表演 - biǎoyǎn🎤⁣
Read below for more information on our new word of the day! Swipe for stroke order.⁣
⁣
🌟表演 means ‘show’, ‘performance, ‘play’. It can also be used as a verb to mean ‘to perform’, ‘to act’. ⁣
⁣
🌠The first character, 表, has several different meanings. It is a very common character and you may have seen it in other words such as 手表 (shǒubiǎo - watch) and 表示 (biǎoshì - to express). In this case, 表 means ‘to show/express’. ⁣
⁣
💅The second character, 演, is the same as in 演员 (yǎnyuán - actor). It also has several different meanings, but in this case it means ‘to perform’, ‘to act’. ⁣
⁣ ⛩Traditional characters: same as simplified⁣
⁣ 📝This is an HSK 4 word!⁣
⁣
⭐️ Example sentences:⁣
- 我们希望你喜欢这个表演。(Wǒmen xīwàng nǐ xǐhuān zhè ge biǎoyǎn.) We hope you will enjoy the show.⁣
- 体育表演 (tǐyù biǎoyǎn) Sports performance ⁣
- 体操表演 (tǐcāo) Gymnastics performance⁣
.⁣
.⁣
.⁣
.⁣
.⁣
#myfirstchinesewords #learnchinese #learnmandarin #language #languagelearning #chineseforkids #chinese #mandarin #flashcards #hsk #cinese #中文 #汉语 #普通话 #wordoftheday #china #中国 #cina #pinyin #chinesecharacter #hanzi #studychinese #汉字 #beijing #shanghai #学习汉语 #drawing #illustration #chinajiayou #standwithchina

💸Expensive - 贵 - guì💸⁣
Read below for more information on our new word of the day! Swipe for stroke order.⁣
⁣
💵贵: one of the first words to learn if you ever plan on visiting China and buying anything at a fair price. If you’re in a small shop or a market, whenever the seller tells you the price just pretend to be shocked and say: 太贵了！便宜一点儿吧。(Tài guì le! Piányí yīdiǎnr ba.) “It’s too expensive! A little cheaper…” You should easily be able to bargain your way down to at least half the price, if not more!⁣
⁣
🐚The radical of the word 贵 is 贝 bèi, which means shellfish, but is also an ancient way to say ‘currency’. Although it is no longer in use it ties in with the definition of 贵, and is helpful when trying to remember what it means. Also, oysters are 贝 (shellfish), and oysters make pearls, so…💰💰💰⁣
⁣
What are your experiences bargaining in China (or elsewhere)? What’s the biggest price reduction you have ever been able to get? Tell us in the comments 😍⁣
⁣
For those of you that want to know more about our word of the day…⁣
Did you know that 贵 is also a very polite, formal way of saying ‘your’? For example, 贵姓 (guìxìng) means ‘your name/surname’. ⁣
⁣
⛩Traditional characters: 貴⁣
⁣
📝This is an HSK 2 word!⁣
⁣
Lastly, during this difficult time, 中国加油 🇨🇳❤️💪🏼⁣
.⁣
.⁣
.⁣
.⁣
.⁣
#myfirstchinesewords #learnchinese #learnmandarin #language #languagelearning #chineseforkids #chinese #mandarin #flashcards #hsk #cinese #中文 #汉语 #普通话 #wordoftheday #china #中国 #cina #pinyin #chinesecharacter #hanzi #studychinese #汉字 #beijing #shanghai #学习汉语 #drawing #illustration #chinajiayou #standwithchina

🏝Free time - 空闲 - kòngxián 🏝⁣
Read below for more information on our new word of the day! Swipe for stroke order.⁣
⁣
🏖空闲 means free time or leisure, but it is mainly used as an adjective. It can be used to describe time such as 空闲时 (kòngxián shí) - free time, spare time, 空闲的时候 (kòngxián de shíhòu) - when one has free time or 空闲的一天 (kòngxián de yītiān) - a free day. ☀️🌴⁣
⁣
⛱ Character by character breakdown:⁣
空 (when alone, it is pronounced kōng) is an HSK 4 that means ‘empty’. It is made up of the radical 穴 (xué), which means cave, and the component 工 (gōng) which means labour, or worker. 闲 (xián) alone can mean ‘free time’, and it is also the opposite of a word most of you will be familiar with, the HSK 2 word 忙 (máng). 🌸⁣
⁣
⛩Traditional characters: 空閑⁣
⁣
📝This is an HSK 5 word!⁣
⁣
💕Example sentences: ⁣
- 我空闲时间不会有很多。Wǒ kòngxián shíjiān bù huì yǒu hěnduō. (I don’t have much free time.)⁣
- 你空闲时间喜欢做什么? Nǐ kòngxián shíjiān xǐhuān zuò shénme? (What do you like to do in your spare time?)⁣
- 不知道你有没有空闲时间见他一面? Bù zhīdào nǐ yǒu méiyǒu kòngxián shíjiān jiàn tā yīmiàn? (I wonder if you have some spare time to see him?)⁣
.⁣
.⁣
.⁣
.⁣
.⁣
#myfirstchinesewords #learnchinese #learnmandarin #language #languagelearning #chineseforkids #chinese #mandarin #flashcards #hsk #cinese #中文 #汉语 #普通话 #wordoftheday #china #中国 #cina #pinyin #chinesecharacter #hanzi #studychinese #汉字 #beijing #shanghai #学习汉语 #drawing #illustration #flamingo #swimmingpool

😤Complain - 抱怨 - bàoyuan (or bàoyuàn)😤⁣
Read below for more information on our new word of the day! Swipe for stroke order.⁣
⁣
👎🏼抱怨 is an HSK 5 word that means ‘to complain’, ‘to grumble’, ‘ to feel dissatisfied’ with something or with a situation. ⁣
⁣
The first character 抱 means ‘hold’, ‘carry in one’s arms’, and also ‘to harbour’. It is an HSK 4 word. It is quite easy to remember if you look at its two components. On the left you can see the ‘hand’ radical⺘(shǒu) , and on the right the component ’bundle’ 包 (bāo): a hand holding a bundle!⁣
⁣
怨 means resentment (as a noun), or ‘resent’, ‘blame’ ‘complain’ as a verb. If you put together the two characters that make up our word of the day, 抱 + 怨, ‘to hold’ + ‘resentment’, you can easily figure out its meaning! If you hold resentment towards something, you are probably going to complain about it!⁣
⁣
⛩Traditional characters: same as simplified⁣
⁣
📝This is an HSK 5 word!⁣
.⁣
.⁣
.⁣
.⁣
.⁣
#myfirstchinesewords #learnchinese #learnmandarin #language #languagelearning #chineseforkids #chinese #mandarin #flashcards #hsk #cinese #中文 #汉语 #普通话 #wordoftheday #china #中国 #cina #pinyin #chinesecharacter #hanzi #studychinese #汉字 #beijing #shanghai #学习汉语 #drawing #illustration #birdpoop #animation

🧨 Firecrackers - 鞭炮 - biānpào 🧨⁣
Read below for more information on our new word of the day! Swipe for stroke order.⁣
⁣
🎇鞭 means ‘whip’ or ‘a string of firecrackers’. You can see on the very left the radical 革 gé, which means leather (whips are usually made of leather, and they are string-like in shape). The other component of the character, on the right side, is 便 biàn (as in 方便 fāngbiàn or 随便 suíbiàn), and it gives the characters its pronunciation. ⁣
⁣
🎆The other character in the Chinese word for firecrackers is 炮. It means ‘big gun’, ‘cannon’ or ‘firecracker’. It is easy to remember because of the radical 火 huǒ (fire) and the component 包 bāo, which means ‘bundle’ or ‘wrapped’ - a bundle of fire!🧨⁣
⁣
🔥If you’re setting off some 鞭炮 the verb to use is 放 fàng: 放鞭炮. ⁣
⁣
🐀Did you know that firecrackers are traditionally set off during Chinese New Year? 🥂 The loud noise they make is said to scare off evil spirits (but watch out, it is also very scary for our pets 🐶🐱). 鞭炮 are also used during many other Chinese festivals, as well as for parties and other social occasions. 🍾⁣
⁣
⛩Traditional characters: same as simplified⁣
⁣
📝This is an HSK 5 word!⁣
.⁣
.⁣
.⁣
.⁣
.⁣
#myfirstchinesewords #learnchinese #learnmandarin #language #languagelearning #chineseforkids #chinese #mandarin #flashcards #hsk #cinese #中文 #汉语 #普通话 #wordoftheday #china #中国 #cina #pinyin #chinesecharacter #hanzi #studychinese #汉字 #beijing #shanghai #学习汉语 #drawing #illustration #chinesenewyear #yearoftherat

🍱Canteen - 食堂- shítáng🍱⁣
Read below for more information on our new word of the day! Swipe for stroke order.⁣
⁣
🍲Anyone who has been to school or university in China is very familiar with the word 食堂, which means canteen/cafeteria. 食 means ‘food’ - you might know it from the HSK 5 word 食物 (shíwù) ‘food’ or 食品 (shípǐn), which means ‘food product’ and can be found on many shop signs. 🥗⁣
⁣
🍕堂 means ‘room used for a specific purpose’. It is quite similar to che character 常 (cháng) which means ‘often’: watch out for the difference in the lower part of the character so you don’t get them mixed up.🍗⁣
⁣
⛩Traditional characters: same as simplified⁣
.⁣
.⁣
.⁣
.⁣
.⁣
#myfirstchinesewords #learnchinese #learnmandarin #language #languagelearning #chineseforkids #chinese #mandarin #flashcards #hsk #cinese #中文 #汉语 #普通话 #wordoftheday #china #中国 #cina #pinyin #chinesecharacter #hanzi #studychinese #汉字 #beijing #shanghai #学习汉语 #lunchbox #bentobox #drawing #illustration

🍉Watermelon - 西瓜 - xīgua🍉⁣
⁣
⬅️ 西 means west, or western, and 瓜 means melon: so watermelon in Chinese is western melon! Why? Apparently because it was originally imported from countries west of China. (Similarly to 南瓜 nángua, pumpkin - southern + melon!) ⁣
⁣
💧Chinese people typically eat a lot of 水果 (shuǐguǒ - fruit). It is also given as a gift to people. 西瓜 is one of the most popular 水果 in China, they are available everywhere and are super refreshing on hot summer days. 🍋🍒🍓🥥🥝🥭🍌⁣
⁣
⛩Traditional characters: same as simplified⁣
⁣
📝 This is an HSK 2 word!⁣
.⁣
.⁣
.⁣
.⁣
.⁣
#myfirstchinesewords #learnchinese #learnmandarin #language #languagelearning #chineseforkids #chinese #mandarin #flashcards #hsk #cinese #中文 #汉语 #普通话 #wordoftheday #china #中国 #cina #pinyin #chinesecharacter #hanzi #studychinese #汉字 #beijing #shanghai #学习汉语 #drawing #illustration #watermelon #fruit

🏃🏻‍♀️To be late - 迟到 - chí dào🏃🏻‍♀️⁣
Read below for more information on our new word of the day! Swipe for stroke order.⁣
⁣
迟到 means to be late, to arrive somewhere late: 迟 means late and 到 means to arrive. ⁣
⁣
📁If you are in China for work, keep in mind that punctuality is highly valued, especially in business and official settings. So don’t 迟到 or it will be seen as very rude and disrespectful! 😠⁣
⁣
⛩Traditional characters: 遲到⁣
⁣ 📝This is an HSK 3 word!⁣
⁣
⭐️Example sentences: ⁣
- 对不起，我迟到了。 (Duìbùqǐ, wǒ chí dào le.) Sorry, I’m late.⁣
- 请大家不要迟到。(Qǐng dàjiā bùyào chí dào. ) Please everybody, don’t be late. ⁣
- 迟到二十分钟。(Chí dào èrshí fēnzhōng.) Be twenty minutes late. ⁣
- 别迟到！(Bié chí dào!) Don’t be late!⁣
.⁣
.⁣
.⁣
.⁣
.⁣
#myfirstchinesewords #learnchinese #learnmandarin #language #languagelearning #chineseforkids #chinese #mandarin #flashcards #hsk #cinese #中文 #汉语 #普通话 #wordoftheday #china #中国 #cina #pinyin #chinesecharacter #hanzi #studychinese #汉字 #beijing #shanghai #学习汉语 #fashion #shopping #drawing #illustration

🎋Bamboo - 竹子 - zhúzi 🎋⁣
Read below for more information on our new word of the day! Swipe for stroke order.⁣
⁣
🐼 Together with 熊猫 (xióngmāo), 丝绸 (sīchóu) and 瓷器 (cíqì)*, 竹子 is something we all immediately associate with China. It is an evergreen plant with a very distinct look - long, cylindrical canes that grow in thick groves. 竹子 is one of the fastest-growing plants in the world, which can make it very environmentally-friendly if grown responsibly! (*Pandas, silk and porcelain)⁣
⁣
🍃In China 竹子 has many uses.  For example, it is used to make chopsticks (竹筷子 zhú kuàizi). It is also used in construction since it is a very strong material, and it can also be used to make furniture and objects of every day use such as baskets, combs, kitchenware etc. 竹子 is also used in cooking - have you ever tried 竹笋 (zhúsǔn - bamboo shoots)?⁣
⁣
🇨🇳竹子 is so important in Chinese culture that the character ‘竹’ is a radical itself and means bamboo. ⁣
⁣
⛩Traditional characters: same as simplified⁣
⁣📝 This is an HSK 5 word! ⁣
.⁣
.⁣
.⁣
.⁣
.⁣

❄️Cold - 冷 - lěng❄️⁣
Read below for more information on our new word of the day! Swipe for stroke order.⁣
⁣
❄️The character 冷 means ‘cold’. It is made up by two parts: the first is the radical⼎bīng, which means ‘ice’, and the other, on the right, is the phonetic part, 令 lìng, which means ‘to order’, ‘to command’, and gives 冷 its pronunciation. ⁣
⁣
🥶 冷 can refer both to temperature and to someone’s tone or manner, just like in English. For example, you can say: ⁣
- 天气冷了。(Tiānqì lěng le.) It’s cold.⁣
And you can also say:⁣
- 冷待 (lěng dài), which means to treat someone coldly. ⁣
⁣
🔥The opposite word is 热 rè, hot. ⁣
⁣
⛩Traditional characters: same as simplified⁣
⁣ 📝 This is an HSK 1 word! ⁣
.⁣
.⁣
.⁣
.⁣
.⁣

🛶Boat - 船 - chuán🛶⁣
Read below for more information on our new word of the day! Swipe for stroke order.⁣
⁣
🌊⛵️船 means boat or ship. The radical is ⾈ (zhōu), which you can see on the left half of 船. ⾈ also means boat but is only used in the written form. Any time you see it, you can be sure that, some way or other, there’s boats involved! ⁣
⁣
🛥You can find it, for example, in the word 龙舟 (lóngzhōu, sometimes also known as 龙船 lóngchuán), which literally means dragon boat 🐲 , a canoe-style boat that typically holds about 20 people and is decorated with dragon heads and tails. These types of boat originated in southern China and are now popular all over the world. 🚤⁣
⁣
上船 (shàngchuán) means to board a boat, therefore 我们在澳门上船去香港 (Wǒmen zài Àomén shàngchuán qù Xiānggǎng) means: We boarded the boat to Hong Kong in Macao. ⁣
⁣
📝 This is an HSK 1 word! ⁣
.⁣
.⁣
.⁣
.⁣
.⁣

👨‍⚕️Doctor - 医生 - yīshēng🧑‍⚕️⁣
Read below for more information on our new word of the day! Swipe for stroke order.⁣
⁣
🏥医 means ‘doctor’, ‘medical’. It is also the first character in 医院 (yīyuàn) which means ‘hospital’. Whenever you see this character, you can be sure it has something to do with medical science and healing. 💉⁣
⁣
🍵Traditional Chinese medicine is called 中医 (Zhōngyī). In this case, the character 中 is an abbreviation for China, 中国. On the other hand, ‘Western’ medicine is called 西医 (xīyī): west + medicine. ⁣
⁣
Another common - but only colloquial - way of saying doctor in Chinese is 大夫 (dàifu). In this case the character 大, which we all know as dà, is pronounced dài. ⁣
⁣
⛩Traditional characters: 醫生⁣
⁣
📝 This is an HSK 1 word! ⁣
⁣
Example sentences: ⁣
- 我妈妈是医生。(Wǒ māmā shì yīshēng.) My mother is a doctor. ⁣
- 他想做医生。(Tā xiǎng zuò yīshēng.) He wants to be a doctor. ⁣
- 医生说她再住几天就能出院了。(Yīshēng shuō tā zài zhù jǐ tiān jiù néng chūyuànle.) The doctor said she can leave the hospital in a few more days. ⁣
.⁣
.⁣
.⁣
.⁣
.⁣

🐴 Horse - 马 - mǎ 🐴⁣
Read below for more information on our new word of the day! Swipe for stroke order.⁣
⁣
🐎马 is one of the first words many Chinese students learn, because it is a syllable often used to explain one of the fundamentals of this beautiful language: tones! Tones give a different meaning to syllables that would otherwise sound the same. ⁣
⁣
These four syllables all share the same sound (“ma”) but they are all pronounced differently and mean completely different things:⁣
妈 mā (1st tone) = mother⁣
麻 má (2nd tone) = hemp⁣
马 mǎ (3rd tone) = horse⁣
骂 mà (4th tone) = to scold, to curse⁣
吗 ma (neutral tone) = used at the end of a statement to turn it into a question⁣
⁣
📝 This is an HSK 3 word! ⁣
⁣
🏇Another HSK 3 word that contains the character 马 is 马上 (mǎshàng) which means ‘right away’, ‘at once’. Literally, it means ‘on the horse’ (马 = horse, 上 = mount). In ancient times horses were the fastest means of transportation, so getting somewhere ‘on a horse’ meant to be getting somewhere very fast, ‘right away’… 🏃🏻‍♀️⁣
⁣
Measure word: 匹 pǐ (for horses, mules, etc.)⁣
⁣
⛩Traditional characters: 馬⁣
.⁣
.⁣
.⁣
.⁣
.⁣

🚽Toilet - 厕所 - cèsuǒ🚽⁣
Read below for more information on our new word of the day! Swipe for stroke order.⁣
⁣
厕所 means toilet or lavatory. 厕 means toilet and 所 means place. Other common ways you may see the word lavatory or bathroom referred to in China are 洗手间 xǐshǒujiān (洗 wash + 手 hand + 间 room) and 卫生间 wèishēngjiān (卫 protect + 生 life + 间 room), especially on street signs or inside large shopping centres. 🧼⁣
⁣
🚻What happens if you need the toilet in China but you’re too far from your flat or hotel room? No need to panic, just look out for blue signs that say: 公共厕所 gōnggòng cèsuǒ or 公共卫生间 gōnggòng wèishēngjiān (公共 means ‘public’). If you need the ladies’ use the door marked 女厕 nǚ cè (女 woman + 厕 toilet) 🚺, and if you need the men’s use the door marked 男厕 (男 man + 厕 toilet) 🚹. ⁣
⁣
If you are looking for a toilet just ask someone: 请问厕所在哪里? (Qǐngwèn cèsuǒ zài nǎlǐ?) - Where is the toilet?⁣
⁣
In China you shouldn’t throw toilet paper (卫生纸 wèishēngzhǐ; 纸 means paper) in the toilet as it may clog up the pipes.  Throw it into a nearby bin instead! Also, remember that it may be hard to find ‘western’ style toilets - most bathrooms in China are only equipped with squat toilets. ⁣
⁣
⛩Traditional characters: 廁所⁣
⁣
📝 This is an HSK 4 word! ⁣
⁣
⁣
.⁣
.⁣
.⁣
.⁣
.⁣

🎂Birthday - 生日 - shēngri 🎂⁣⁣
Read below for more information on our new word of the day! Swipe for stroke order. ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
🥳 Today it’s our birthday! We are one year old! ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
💖 We created this Instagram page with the intention of helping learners of Chinese memorise words that are useful in everyday life with the help of cute, animated illustrations, an animated stroke order and an explanation for each word. ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
Most of all, we want to thank each and every one of you for your support, for your likes, for your lovely comments and for interacting with us! 🥰🥰🥰 We will keep going and hopefully add more features the more we get to understand what you guys want. So… thank you!⁣⁣
⁣⁣
🎂生日 literally means ‘birth + day’. 生 means to give birth, to be born, to come into existence, and 日 means day. ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
⭐️ Did you know that the Chinese happy birthday song has the same music as the English one? 🎵 Happy birthday to youuu 🎵 Try singing it in Chinese: ⁣⁣
祝你生日快乐,⁣⁣
祝你生日快乐,⁣⁣
祝你生日快乐,⁣⁣
祝你生日快乐!⁣⁣
(Zhù nǐ shēngrì kuàilè x 4)⁣⁣
.⁣⁣
.⁣⁣

🧘🏾‍♀️Yoga - 瑜伽 - yújiā 🧘🏻‍♂️⁣
Read below for more information on our new word of the day! Swipe for stroke order.⁣
⁣
🙏 瑜伽 is an ancient Indian tradition of spiritual, physical and mental practices that are said to date back to over 5000 years ago. Many of you may know yoga especially for its physical exercises, or ‘asanas’. In Chinese, asanas, or yoga poses, are known as 瑜伽体式 yújiā tǐshì. But there is a lot more to yoga than 瑜伽体式!⁣
⁣
🧘🏾‍♀️ ‘瑜伽’ is a ‘loanword’, meaning it is an attempt to recreate the sound of the original word, without giving too much thought to the meaning of the individual characters. This is the case with 瑜伽, where 瑜 is an ancient word for saying ‘gem’, or ‘jade’, and the character 伽 actually has no meaning! ⁣
⁣
🧘🏻‍♂️Have you ever practiced 瑜伽? ‘To practice yoga’ in Chinese is 练瑜伽 (liàn yújiā). 练 is the second character in a word that you probably have already encountered - 锻炼 duànliàn - which means ‘to exercise’. ⁣
⁣
🕉 Have you ever been to a 瑜伽 class? In China, you would go to a 瑜伽课(yújiā kè, 课 meaning ‘class’, ‘lesson’). ⁣
⁣
⛩Traditional characters: same as simplified⁣
⁣
📝 瑜伽 is not an HSK word!⁣
.⁣
.⁣
.⁣
.⁣
.⁣

💦Water - 水 - shuǐ💦⁣
Read below for more information on our new word of the day! Swipe for stroke order.⁣
⁣
Travelling to China? Learn how to ask for water! ⁣
🍾If you want a bottle of water, ask for 一瓶水 (yī píng shuǐ): 瓶 means bottle. ⁣
🥛If you want a glass of water, ask for 一杯水 (yī bēi shuǐ): 杯 means glass, or cup. (Watch out! A glass of water in China will often come filled with hot water, not cold or room temperature! This is because, according to traditional Chinese medicine, drinking hot water balances out cold and humidity in the body and cures a number of ailments. Drinking cold or ice water, on the other hand, is considered bad for the body! It might seem strange at first, but if you get the chance to you should give it a go!)⁣
⁣
⛩Traditional characters: same as simplified⁣
⁣
📝 This is an HSK 1 word! ⁣
.⁣
.⁣
.⁣
.⁣
.⁣

🍟Fries - 薯条 - shǔtiáo 🍟⁣
Read below for more information on our new word of the day! Swipe for stroke order.⁣
⁣
薯 (shǔ) means potato or yam. 条 means a strip of something. (You may have seen the word 条 as a measure word for long, flexible things such as a street or a pair of trousers.)⁣
⁣
✏️ How can we remember this word? 薯 has the radical 艹 (cǎo) that means grass. It is placed on the uppermost part of the character, with a lot going on underneath (however in this case it doesn’t have anything to the meaning of the word so we will not be looking into it). Potatoes grow underground, so just by looking at it you can think of 薯as a potato growing underneath the grass, minding its own business. 🥔 🌱 ⁣
⁣
👖 条 we already said is a measure word for long, thin, flexible things, and 薯条 are themselves long, thin, flexible things! ⁣
⁣
Do you guys like 薯条? What do you call them in your own language? ⁣
.⁣
.⁣
.⁣
.⁣
.⁣
⁣

⁣
🏢Library - 图书馆 - túshūguǎn🏢⁣
Read below for more information on our new word of the day! Swipe for stroke order.⁣
⁣
📚What can you do in a 图书馆? You can 学习 xuéxí (study), and also  借书 jiè shū (borrow a book). ⁣
⁣
📘The first character, 图 (tú), means diagram, drawing or map, 书 (shū) means book and 馆 (guǎn) means building. So 图书馆 is a building full of books, diagrams and maps! ⁣
⁣
⛩Traditional characters: 圖書館⁣
⁣
📝 This is an HSK 3 word! ⁣
⁣
Example sentences:⁣
- 从图书馆借书。(Cóng túshūguǎn jiè shū.) Borrow books from the library.⁣
- 他们在图书馆里做作业。(Tāmen zài túshūguǎn lǐ zuò zuo yè.) They do their homework in the library.⁣
- 我经常去图书馆。(Wǒ jīngcháng qù túshūguǎn.) I go to the library often.⁣
- 图书馆七点半开门。(Túshūguǎn qī diǎn bàn kāi mén.) The library opens at half past seven.⁣
- 他是图书管理员。(Tā shì túshūguǎnlǐyuán.) He is a librarian.⁣
.⁣
.⁣
.⁣

.⁣

⛈Rain - 雨 - yǔ⛈⁣
Read below for more information on our new word of the day! Swipe for stroke order.⁣
⁣
☂️雨 means ‘rain’. It is often seen near the verb 下 (xià), which means to descend: 下雨 (xiàyǔ) means ‘to rain’. When it starts raining in China, you will often hear people day “下雨了!” (xiàyǔle), and it means: “It started to rain!” 🌧⁣
⁣
🌦The history of 雨 is very interesting. Like many of the most ancient Chinese characters, 雨 is an ideogram, meaning that it is a symbol that represents an idea. ⁣
⁣
🌧If you look closely and use your imagination, it can look like drops of water falling from the sky. The four dots you can see (called 点 diăn) represent lots of raindrops! This makes the character easy to memorise and to differentiate from similar characters.⁣
⁣
🌈 雨 is also a helpful character because it is the radical (⻗) of some words that have to do with rain, such as 雪 xuě (snow) ❄️, 雷 léi (thunder) ⚡️and 露 lù (dew). ⁣
⁣
📝 This is an HSK 1 word!⁣
⁣
Traditional characters: same as simplified⁣
